title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: WASH FACILITIES AND HYGIENEEDUCATION IN SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Output 2.2: An increased number of schools in at least nine disadvantaged counties have gender-sensitive water and sanitation facilities and health and hygiene education, including MHM

sector.narrative: Provision of primary education teacher training
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support

related-activity.ref: 2400/A0/06/002 OUTCOME 2: IMPROVED EARLY LEARNING AND EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: An increased number of schools in at least nine disadvantaged counties have gender-sensitive water and sanitation facilities and health and hygiene education, including MHM

description.narrative: Gender and disability sensitive Water, Sanitation and Hygiene services were provided in 96 schools (against a target of 50) in ten counties and benefiting 70,696 children, of which 95 schools are implementing Menstrual Hygiene Management education. Standards and guidelines for WASH infrastructure in schools have been developed, approved and officially launched. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of schools with Menstrual Hygiene Management implemented in schools programmes as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes.
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
